meanings.definition: The act of jumping as far as possible in one leap.
meanings.sent1: Longjumping requires strength and agility to leap a great distance.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's longjumping technique was flawless, allowing them to soar through the air.
meanings.sent3: During the longjumping competition, the crowd cheered loudly for each participant.
meanings.sent4: Her determination in longjumping was like a bird spreading its wings and taking flight.
meanings.sent5: The longjumping event at the school carnival was the highlight of the day.

meanings.definition: A sport in which athletes compete to jump the farthest distance.
meanings.sent1: In longjumping, athletes strive to outdo each other by leaping the farthest.
meanings.sent2: The longjumping competition at the Olympics was intense and exciting.
meanings.sent3: The longjumping team practiced diligently to improve their chances of winning.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to longjumping was like a flame burning brightly in the night.
meanings.sent5: The longjumping pit was marked with colorful flags for the upcoming tournament.

meanings.definition: To participate in the sport of longjumping.
meanings.sent1: She loves longjumping and trains every day to improve her skills.
meanings.sent2: Athletes from around the world will gather to longjump at the championship.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be longjumping as it leaped from one rooftop to another.
meanings.sent4: His passion for longjumping was evident in the way he approached each practice session.
meanings.sent5: The children pretended they were longjumping over imaginary obstacles in the park.
